title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to the boil. Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente (about 9–11 minutes). Reserve 1 cup of pasta water, then drain.
While the pasta cooks, fry the guanciale or pancetta in a large pan over medium heat until crisp and golden (about 8–10 minutes). Remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, whole eggs, Pecorino, Parmesan, and a generous amount of black pepper until smooth.

Add the hot pasta to the pan with the guanciale. Off the heat, pour in the egg mixture and toss quickly. Add a splash of reserved pasta water to loosen and create a silky sauce. Serve immediately with extra Pecorino and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: Fresh coriander and lime to serve
instructions: Mix the chicken with the yogurt and 1 tbsp tikka paste. Cover and marinate for at least 30 minutes (or overnight in the fridge).
Heat the oil in a large pan. Fry the chicken in batches until golden and cooked through. Set aside.
In the same pan, fry the onion until soft. Add the garlic and remaining tikka paste and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in the cream and garam masala. Return the chicken to the pan and simmer for 5 minutes. Season and serve with rice, coriander, and lime.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A quick and healthy dish with crisp vegetables and a savory soy sauce glaze.
ingredients: 1 head of broccoli, cut into florets
Cooked rice or noodles to serve
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a wok or large frying pan over high heat. Add the broccoli and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add the pepper, carrot, and snap peas and stir-fry for another 3 minutes until tender-crisp. Transfer to a plate.
Add the remaining oil to the pan. Fry the garlic and ginger for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Return the vegetables to the pan. Add the soy sauce and rice vinegar and toss for 1–2 minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve over rice or noodles.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Seasoned ground beef in crispy tortillas with fresh toppings and salsa.
ingredients: 8–10 small soft or hard taco shells
Shredded lettuce, diced tomato, grated cheese, sour cream, salsa, lime and coriander to serve
instructions: Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the beef and onion and cook until the beef is browned and the onion is soft (about 8 minutes). Drain excess fat if needed.
Stir in the cumin, paprika, chilli powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1 minute. Add a splash of water if the mixture is dry.
Warm the taco shells according to package directions. Fill with the beef and top with lettuce, tomato, cheese, sour cream, salsa, lime, and coriander. Serve immediately.
